Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the PRRA Officer breached procedural fairness or made unreasonable determinations in assessing risk upon return to Sri Lanka
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant returned to Canada without authorization after deportation and sought protection based on claimed risks in Sri Lanka
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: PRRA Officer found no significant risk; application for protection denied
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Deported individual who re-entered Canada illegally
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Re-entered Canada without authorization following deportation due to criminality
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Risk of harm upon return to Sri Lanka
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Reasonableness for factual and mixed questions; correctness for procedural fairness
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Objective evidence and applicant submissions considered
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Alleged lack of interview and reliance on undisclosed post-application documents
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Pre-application country condition reports and publicly available documents
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: Sections of IRPA related to PRRA and risk assessment
Crimes.Application_Basis: Prejudice or danger in country of origin (Sri Lanka)
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Documentation regarding human rights conditions in Sri Lanka
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Stay of removal and acceptance of PRRA application
Crimes.Governing_Rule: PRRA decisions must be reasonable and procedurally fair
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: None found by court; documents were public before application
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Alleged risk from state and non-state actors in Sri Lanka
Crimes.Cause_Description: Mr. Manickavasagar, deported due to criminality, returned illegally and sought protection from risks in Sri Lanka
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Post-application documents used but were publicly available prior to submission
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: Section 36(2)(a) IRPA – risk to life, liberty, or security
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: No breach of procedural fairness in use of evidence
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: Failed – overstayed and re-entered without authorization
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Authority of PRRA Officer under IRPA
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: No credible basis for fear of persecution; country conditions did not support claim
Crimes.Decision_Making_Body: Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship Canada (IRCC) PRRA Officer
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Use of publicly available post-facto documents deemed acceptable
Crimes.Legal_Standard_Applied: Reasonableness standard applied to factual findings

Crimes.Violation_Type: Remaining in Canada beyond authorized period
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the PRRA Officer's decision was procedurally fair and reasonable
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant overstayed his visa after deportation and reapplied for protection, claiming risk in Sri Lanka
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: PRRA application rejected due to lack of substantiated risk
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Former temporary resident who became undocumented after overstaying
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Failed to leave Canada upon expiration of status and later applied for PRRA
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Fear of persecution or harm in Sri Lanka upon return
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Availability and reliability of country condition information
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Failure to disclose post-application evidence used in decision-making
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Not a key factor as claims were supported by general country evidence
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Publicly available country reports and documentation
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: IRPA provisions governing PRRA eligibility and risk assessment
Crimes.Application_Basis: Human rights situation in Sri Lanka affecting returnees
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Generalized reports on political and civil conditions in Sri Lanka
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Acceptance of PRRA application and protection from removal
Crimes.Governing_Rule: PRRA decisions must consider all relevant evidence and follow procedural fairness
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: None identified – documents used were already public
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Potential harm due to ethnic or political profile in Sri Lanka
Crimes.Cause_Description: Applicant overstayed his visa after deportation and reapplied for protection, claiming risk in Sri Lanka
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Reliance on pre-existing public documents considered appropriate
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: IRPA Section 18(1) – obligation to leave at end of status
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: No unfairness in using publicly accessible documents
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: Non-compliant – remained beyond validity of visa
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: No individualized risk established despite generalized concerns
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: No procedural unfairness in evidence usage
Crimes.Legal_Standard_Applied: Standard of reasonableness applied to administrative decision

Crimes.Crime_Name: Failure to Obtain Authorization to Return Under Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Dispute_Type: Refusal of PRRA due to unauthorized return
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the PRRA Officer breached procedural fairness or made unreasonable factual determinations
Crimes.Outcome: PRRA application refused; judicial review dismissed
Crimes.Procedural_Context: PRRA application following deportation and re-entry without authorization
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Documentary evidence including country condition reports
Crimes.Legal_Provision: IRPA Section 117 – need for Authorization to Return (A2R)
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Risk of mistreatment in Sri Lanka
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Lack of corroborating evidence supporting personal risk
Crimes.Application_Error: Returning without obtaining required Authorization to Return
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: None found – officer reviewed available evidence
Crimes.Application_Factor: Unauthorized re-entry affects eligibility for PRRA consideration
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Use of post-application documents and adequacy of risk assessment
Crimes.Governing_Rule_or_Provision: IRPA Section 117(1) – requirement for A2R after deportation
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: No significant risk found; failure to obtain A2R
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Applicant failed to provide sufficient corroborative evidence
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Met – no duty to disclose publicly available documents
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Claims not sufficiently supported by evidence
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Allegation of procedural unfairness due to undisclosed evidence
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Focus: Canadian immigration law and refugee protection
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Use of post-submission public documents without direct disclosure
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to apply for and obtain Authorization to Return
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility: Criminality leading to deportation and subsequent unauthorized return

Crimes.Violation_Type: Deportation due to serious criminal offense
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the PRRA Officer breached procedural fairness or made unreasonable factual determinations
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant had been deported due to serious criminality and returned without permission, then filed a PRRA
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: PRRA application denied; risk not substantiated
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Criminally inadmissible permanent resident subject to deportation
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Committed serious crime, deported, then re-entered Canada without authorization
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Risk of torture or harm if returned to Sri Lanka
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Reasonableness of factual findings; correctness for procedural fairness
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Weight given to objective country evidence versus personal narrative
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Allegation that officer ignored submitted evidence and relied on undisclosed documents
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Not pivotal; focus on documentary evidence
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Country condition reports, UNHCR guidelines, and government advisories
Crimes.Application_Basis: Personalized risk based on past detention and political affiliation
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Submitted affidavits, news articles, and expert reports
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Recognition under PRRA and protection from removal
Crimes.Governing_Rule: PRRA officers must conduct fair and thorough assessments
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Insufficient proof of ongoing individualized risk
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Alleged history of arbitrary detention and surveillance in Sri Lanka
Crimes.Cause_Description: Applicant’s deportation due to serious criminality and subsequent return without permission led to a PRRA application
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Post-application documents used were publicly available before filing
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: IRPA s. 36(2)(a) – danger to life, liberty, or security
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: No procedural unfairness in evidence selection
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: Violated – entered without authorization after deportation
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Jurisdiction of PRRA Officer over applicants with criminal inadmissibility
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Balanced and reasonable weighing of all evidence
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: No clear evidence of current risk despite adverse country conditions
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: No breach of fairness in handling of evidence
Crimes.Legal_Standard_Applied: Reasonableness standard applied to risk determination
